intro: Galium kikumugura, commonly known as the mountain bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in umbels, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium kikumugura thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests and grasslands.
